catalog_info.title: Mechanics, Elasticity, Fluids, and Diffusion
catalog_info.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Science of the Physical Universe or Empirical and Mathematical Reasoning, but not both.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Physical Sciences 1 (or Chemistry 7), Mathematics 1b, or the equivalent.
catalog_info.description: An introduction to classical mechanics, with special emphasis on the motion of organisms in fluids. Topics covered include: kinematics, Newton's laws of motion, oscillations, elasticity, random walks, diffusion, and fluids. Examples and problem set questions will be drawn from the life sciences and medicine.
catalog_info.course_group: Physical Sciences Physical Sciences Physical Sciences
